qas.question: What is another term for xalwo?
Along with wedding receptions, when is xalwo often consumed?
What do the Somalis call frankincense?
What is the English word for cunnsi?
What do the Somalis call incense burners?

context: Xalwo (<a0_0>halva<a0_0/>) is a popular confection eaten during festive occasions, such as <a1_0>Eid celebrations<a1_0/> or wedding receptions. It is made from sugar, corn starch, cardamom powder, nutmeg powder and ghee. Peanuts are also sometimes added to enhance texture and flavor. After meals, homes are traditionally perfumed using frankincense (<a2_0>lubaan<a2_0/>) or <a3_0>incense<a3_0/> (cuunsi), which is prepared inside an incense burner referred to as a <a4_0>dabqaad<a4_0/>.
